00018 /**
00019 
00020 
00021 @page toolchains OCTEON Toolchains
00022 
00023 @section toolchains_introduction Introduction
00024 
00025   This page provides information about toolchains found in the SDK:
00026 
00027     - @ref toolchains_toolchains
00028     - @ref toolchain_exec
00029     - @ref toolchain_linux
00030     - @ref toolchain_versions
00031     - @ref toolchain_changes
00032     - @ref toolchain_upgrade_guide
00033 
00034 @section toolchains_toolchains Supported Toolchains
00035 
00036   The SDK provides three OCTEON toolchains.  All three toolchains are based on
00037   the standard GNU toolchain consisting of GCC (C/C++), GDB, C library, the
00038   GNU assembler and the GNU linker.  These are all built from the same source
00039   but use different target or host configurations.
00040 
00041     -# A toolchain to build OCTEON Simple-executive programs.  This is a cross
00042     toolchain hosted for x86 Linux.  See @ref toolchain_exec.
00043     -# A cross toolchain to build OCTEON Linux programs.  This cross toolchain
00044     is x86 Linux hosted.  See @ref toolchain_linux.
00045     -# A native toolchain to build OCTEON Linux programs.  See @ref
00046     toolchain_linux.
00047 
00048 
00049 @section toolchain_exec Simple-executive Toolchain
00050 
00051   This toolchain is derived from the standard mipsisa64r2-elf configuration.
00052   It uses newlib as its C library.
00053 
00054   This toolchain supports the EABI (default) and the non-PIC N32 (-mabi=n32)
00055   ABIs.
00056 
00057   The toolchain option -march=octeon2, generates optimized code with new instructions 
00058   to run on OCTEON II. Separate C libraries are provided for both EABI and n32 ABIs.
00059 
00060   The toolchain option -march=octeon3, generates optimized code with new instructions 
00061   to run on OCTEON III including hard float. Separate C libraries are provided for both EABI and n32 ABIs.
00062 
00063   The GDB in this toolchain has been extended with two new targets:
00064 
00065     -# octeon: to debug the program running either on the simulator or on the
00066     HW using the serial port.
00067     -# octeonpci: to debug the program running on the HW using the PCI
00068     interface.
00069 
00070   After setting up the OCTEON environment with env-setup the tools can be
00071   accessed with the mipsisa64-elf- prefix (e.g. mipsisa64-elf-gcc).
00072 
00073 @section toolchain_linux Linux Toolchains
00074 
00075   Both the Linux cross and native toolchains are derived from the
00076   mips64octeon-linux-gnu target.
00077 
00078   This toolchain supports the N64 (default) and the N32 (-mabi=n32) ABIs.
00079 
00080   The toolchain option -march=octeon2, generates optimized code with new instructions
00081   to run on OCTEON II. Separate glibc libraries are provided for both N64 and N32 ABIs.
00082 
00083   The toolchain option -march=octeon3, generates optimized code with new instructions
00084   to run on OCTEON III including hardfloat. Separate glibc libraries are provided for both N64 and N32 ABIs.
00085 
00086 @subsection toolchain_cross Linux Cross Toolchain
00087 
00088   The cross toolchain support GLIBC as its C library.
00089 
00090   After setting up the OCTEON environment with env-setup the tools can be
00091   accessed with the mips64-octeon-linux-gnu- prefix
00092   (e.g. mips64-octeon-linux-gnu-gcc).
00093 
00094 @subsection toolchain_native Linux Native Toolchain
00095 
00096   The native toolchain support GLIBC as its C library.
00097 
00098   On the Debian root file system the OCTEON native toolchain can be found
00099   under /usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/tools/usr/bin.
00100 
00101   @note that you need to manually set the path to this toolchain otherwise you
00102   will use the standard Debian toolchain under /usr/bin:
00103 
00104 @verbatim
00105   PATH=/usr/local/Cavium_Networks/OCTEON-SDK/tools/usr/bin:$PATH
00106 @endverbatim
00107 
00108 @section toolchain_versions Version of the Tools
00109 
00110  - GCC 4.7.0
00111  - binutils 2.23.2
00112  - GDB 7.6
00113  - GLIBC 2.16
00114  - newlib 1.19.0
00115  - DDD 3.3.11
00116 
00117 @section toolchain_changes Cavium Toolchain Improvements
00118 
00119   This section list the improvements made to the open-source version of the
00120   tools.
00121 
00122 @subsection gcc_changes GCC
00123 
00124   - Configuration for the Simple Executive.
00125   - Optimization to merge constant bit-field stores.
00126   - Optimization to eliminate redundant load operations created by reload.
00127   - Create core-specific profile-feedback data files.  See @ref fdo.
00128   - Utility to merge profile-feedback data files.    See @ref fdo.
00129   - Install the utility to dump the contents of profile-feedback data files.
00130   - Support basic-block probability annotation with __builtin_block_prob.
00131   - Stack unwind support through the first exception frame in the Simple
00132   Executive.
00133   - Handling of the cvmx_shared attribute.
00134   - TLS optimization.  See @ref linux_tls.
00135   - Flag to disable MADD generation.
00136   - Many other optimizations not listed here.
00137   - Read the release notes for other changes.
00138 
00139 @subsection gdb_changes GDB
00140 
00141   - "octeon" target to debug simple-exec or the linux kernel through serial port or simulator.
00142   - "octeonpci" target to debug simple-exec or linux kernel through PCI.
00143   - Multi-core debugging support in the OCTEON targets.
00144   - Support for OCTEON performance counters in the OCTEON targets.
00145   - Support for HW watchpoint and HW breakpoint in the OCTEON targets.
00146   - Backtrace via exception handler frame in the OCTEON targets.
00147   - Run command support in the OCTEON targets.
00148   - Handle BBIT in the MIPS branch emulation code.
00149   - Use the DWARF unwinder.
00150   - Read the release notes for other changes.
00151 
00152 @subsection binutils_changes binutils
00153 
00154   - Configurations for the Simple Executive.
00155   - Optimize ULH macro for MIPS64r2.
00156   - Disassemble OCTEON cop0 registers.
00157   - Read the release notes for other changes.
00158 
00159 @subsection glibc_changes GLIBC
00160 
00161   - TLS optimization
00162   - Fix numerous system calls to work with N32 and N64 ABIs
00163   - Read the release notes for other changes.
00164 
00165 @subsection newlib_changes newlib
00166 
00167   - Tuned version of memcpy, memcmp, memset, strlen, strcmp.
00168   - Basic UART printing.
00169   - New API backtrace to print or walk stack trace.  See @ref backtrace.
00170   - Very basic memory-mapped file system for profile-feedback data collection on simple-exec.
00171   - Simulator simmagic support.
00172   - PCI console write functions.
00173   - Application init and CRTs.
00174   - Read the release notes for other changes.
00175 
00176 @section toolchain_upgrade_guide Transition Guide from the Previous Toolchain
00177 
00178   SDK 3.1 is the first SDK providing the new GCC 4.7.0-based toolchain.
00179   For a porting guide when porting to GCC 4.7 from GCC 4.3
00180   see https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.7/porting_to.html and
00181   https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-4.6/porting_to.html.
00182 
00183 */
